article_title: In Image-Guided Operating Suites, Surgeons See Real-Time MRI, CT Scans
article_text:
Surgeons sometimes fly blind when operating on hard-to-reach anatomical parts or hard-to-see conditions. For visual references inside the brain or body, they often rely on images and scans taken before an operation.

A growing number of hospitals are equipping operating suites with magnetic resonance imaging, CT scanners and other technology that enables surgeons to scan a patient in real time, without having to move them from the...

twitter.description: To improve safety and reduce risk, more hospitals are spending millions of dollars on image-guided operating suites, with MRI and CT scans to provide more real-time visual information about patients during procedures on the operating table.
